<!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]] |postal_code = 91746 |area_code = [[Area code 626|626]] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 06-03344 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 1724314 |website = |footnotes = }} '''Avocado Heights''' is an [[unincorporated area|unincorporated]] [[census-designated place]] in [[Los Angeles County, California|Los Angeles County]], California, United States. It lies in the [[San Gabriel Valley]], near [[Puente Hills]]. On the northern border lies the unincorporated community of [[West Puente Valley, California|West Puente Valley]]; on the eastern border the [[Industry, California|City of Industry]]. A thin strip of the City of Industry runs to the south, and the [[California State Route 60|Pomona Freeway]] and the Puente Hills are further south. To the west is the [[San Gabriel River (California)|San Gabriel River]] and the [[Interstate 605|San Gabriel River Freeway]], as well as the California Country Club. Avocado Heights is approximately {{convert|15|mi|km}} from the [[downtown Los Angeles]] Civic Center. The population was 15,411 at the 2010 census, up from 15,148 at the 2000 census.
==Geography== Avocado Heights is located at {{coord|34|2|19|N|118|0|16|W|type:city}} (34.038610, â118.004575),{{GR|1}} or about three miles (5 km) southeast of [[El Monte, California|El Monte]].<ref>[http://www.city-data.com/city/Avocado-Heights-California.html http://www.city-data.com/city/Avocado-Heights-California.html] ''city-data.com''</ref> According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of {{convert|2.8|sqmi|km2}}. {{convert|2.7|sqmi|km2}} of it is land, and {{convert|0.1|sqmi|km2}} of it (4.77%) is water.
==Demographics== {{USCensusPop |1970=9810 |1980=11721 |1990=14232 |2000=15148 |2010=15411 |footnotes=<ref>[http://bld.lib.ca.us/virtualreference/calif_historical_census_population.htm]</ref> }} ===2010=== The [[2010 United States Census]]<ref>{{USCensus-2010CA}}</ref> reported that Avocado Heights had a population of 15,411. The [[population density]] was 5,423.8 people per square mile (2,094.1/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of Avocado Heights was 8,564 (55.6%) [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 136 (0.9%) [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 107 (0.7%) [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 1,359 (8.8%) [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 13 (0.1%) [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 4,726 (30.7%) from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 506 (3.3%) from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 12,648 persons (82.1%).
The Census reported that 15,332 people (99.5% of the population) lived in households, 79 (0.5%) lived in non-institutionalized group quarters, and 0 (0%) were institutionalized.
There were 3,813 households, out of which 1,900 (49.8%) had children under the age of 18 living in them, 2,351 (61.7%) were [[marriage|opposite-sex married couples]] living together, 622 (16.3%) had a female householder with no husband present, 331 (8.7%) had a male householder with no wife present. There were 205 (5.4%) [[POSSLQ|unmarried opposite-sex partnerships]], and 23 (0.6%) [[same-sex partnerships|same-sex married couples or partnerships]]. 368 households (9.7%) were made up of individuals and 181 (4.7%) had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 4.02. There were 3,304 [[family (U.S. Census)|families]] (86.7% of all households); the average family size was 4.16.
The population was spread out with 4,210 people (27.3%) under the age of 18, 1,676 people (10.9%) aged 18 to 24, 4,277 people (27.8%) aged 25 to 44, 3,575 people (23.2%) aged 45 to 64, and 1,673 people (10.9%) who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 33.7 years. For every 100 females there were 98.5 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 96.4 males.
There were 3,922 housing units at an average density of 1,380.3 per square mile (532.9/kmÂ²), of which 2,934 (76.9%) were owner-occupied, and 879 (23.1%) were occupied by renters. The homeowner vacancy rate was 0.7%; the rental vacancy rate was 3.1%. 11,422 people (74.1% of the population) lived in owner-occupied housing units and 3,910 people (25.4%) lived in rental housing units.
===2000=== As of the 2000 [[census]]{{GR|2}}, the population was 15,148, with 3,758 households, and 3,280 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 5,675.7 inhabitants per square mile (2,190.5/kmÂ²). There were 3,839 housing units at an average density of 1,438.4 per square mile (555.1/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of the CDP was 51.43% [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census|White]], 1.47% [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census|Black]] or [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census|African American]], 1.16% [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census|Native American]], 9.12% [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census|Asian]], 0.11% [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census|Pacific Islander]], 33.06% from [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census|other races]], and 3.66% from two or more races. 77.74% of the population were [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census|Hispanic]] or [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census|Latino]] of any race.
Of the 3,758 households, 45.6% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 66.0% were married couples living together, 14.2% had a female householder with no husband present, and 12.7% were non-families. 9.7% of all households were made up of individuals and 3.8% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 4.00 and the average family size was 4.16.
The age range was 30.9% under the age of 18, 10.9% from 18 to 24, 29.5% from 25 to 44, 20.0% from 45 to 64, and 8.7% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 30 years. For every 100 females there were 99.3 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 97.5 males.
The median income for a household in the CDP was $48,712, and the median income for a family was $48,939. Males had a median income of $30,837 versus $26,481 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $14,570. About 13.2% of families and 16.3% of the population were below the [[Poverty threshold|poverty line]], including 22.0% of those under age 18 and 9.8% of those age 65 or over.
==Government== In the [[California State Legislature|state legislature]] Avocado Heights is located in the 24th [[California State Senate|Senate]] District, represented by Democrat [[Gloria J. Romero|Gloria Romero]], and in the 57th [[California State Assembly|Assembly]] District, represented by Democrat [[Edward HernÃ¡ndez]].
Avocado Heights is located in [[California's 38th congressional district]], which has a [[Cook Partisan Voting Index|Cook PVI]] of D +20<ref>{{cite web | title = Will Gerrymandered Districts Stem the Wave of Voter Unrest? | publisher = Campaign Legal Center Blog | url=http://www.clcblog.org/blog_item-85.html | accessdate = 2008-02-10}}</ref> and is represented by Democrat [[Grace Napolitano]].
